Package com.example.cymarket.Services

Class WebSocketService

java.lang.Object
android.content.Context
android.content.ContextWrapper
android.app.Service
com.example.cymarket.Services.WebSocketService
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
public class WebSocketService extends android.app.Service
Service that manages WebSocket connections using Java-WebSocket.

This service supports connecting, sending messages, and disconnecting multiple WebSocket clients identified by unique keys.

Author:
Tyler Mestery

    • onCreate

      public void onCreate()

    • onStartCommand

      public int onStartCommand(android.content.Intent intent, int flags, int startId)
      Called by the system every time a client starts the service using startService(Intent). Handles WebSocket connection and disconnection requests based on the Intent's action. Supported actions:
      • "WS_CONNECT": Connects to a WebSocket. Requires extras "key" and "url".
      • "WS_DISCONNECT": Disconnects an existing WebSocket. Requires extra "key".
      Overrides:
      onStartCommand in class android.app.Service
      Parameters:
      intent - The Intent supplied to startService(), containing action and extras.
      flags - Additional data about the start request (unused here).
      startId - A unique integer representing this specific request to start.
      Returns:
      Service.START_STICKY to indicate the service should remain running until explicitly stopped.

    • connect

      private void connect(String key, String url)
      Connects a WebSocket client for a given key and URL.
      Parameters:
      key - unique identifier for the WebSocket
      url - WebSocket URL

    • disconnect

      private void disconnect(String key)
      Disconnects the WebSocket associated with the given key.
      Parameters:
      key - unique identifier for the WebSocket
